steps.observation: Alfred Antony Francis Gell, {'1': ", '2': ", '3': ", '4': "} ( ; June 12, 1945 – January 28, 1997) was a British social anthropologist whose most influential work concerned art, language, symbolism and ritual.  He was trained by Edmund Leach (MPhil, Cambridge University) and Raymond Firth (PhD, London School of Economics) and did his fieldwork in Melanesia and tribal India.  Gell taught at the London School of Economics, among other places.  He was also a Fellow of the British Academy.  He died of cancer in 1997, at the age of 51.

steps.thought: I now have information about Alfred Gell's nationality, which is British. However, I still need to find information about Edmund Leach's nationality. I can search again, focusing on Edmund Leach this time.

steps.observation: Sir Edmund Ronald Leach (7 November 1910 – 6 January 1989) was a British social anthropologist.
